accounts.name: SOMIC Verpackungsmaschinen
accounts.what_they_make: End-of-line packaging machines for food/sweets/pharma.
accounts.why_fit: Drawing-heavy custom machinery; frequent customer-specific variants and documentation packages (inference from business model).

accounts.name: MULTIVAC
accounts.what_they_make: Packaging machines/lines for food, life science/healthcare, industrial goods.
accounts.why_fit: High part counts + line variants; drawing generation/checking can reduce engineering bottlenecks in modular machine platforms (inference).

accounts.name: Krones
accounts.what_they_make: Complete beverage/liquid-food processing, bottling, packaging, intralogistics & recycling lines.
accounts.why_fit: Very drawing- and PLM-intensive machinery portfolio; explicit Teamcenter configuration role suggests complex change/release workflows.
accounts.cad_plm_signals: Teamcenter explicitly (configuration/customization role). NX usage referenced in a published case about NX CAE at Krones.

accounts.name: Kiefel
accounts.what_they_make: Thermoforming and welding machine solutions for polymers & natural fibers; system supplier from product development to series production.
accounts.why_fit: Tooling + machine platforms tend to be drawing-heavy; automation can standardize drawing packs and DFM checks for formed parts (inference).

accounts.name: ROFA Industrial Automation
accounts.what_they_make: Turnkey conveyor systems, automation, intralogistics and special machine construction.
accounts.why_fit: Project-based equipment → frequent revisions and multi-discipline handoffs; strong fit for drawing checks + release-package automation (inference).
accounts.cad_plm_signals: Public PLM signal: listed as a customer of PRO.FILE (document/product lifecycle management solution).

accounts.name: Grenzebach
accounts.what_they_make: Industrial automation solutions and production plant engineering (e.g., glass & materials industries, intralogistics, etc.).
accounts.why_fit: Complex product structures and cross-functional coordination (inference); automation tool aligns with drawing/release discipline.
accounts.cad_plm_signals: PLM signal: public case describes EPLAN integration into PTC Windchill at Grenzebach (indicates formal PLM backbone, though not Teamcenter).

accounts.name: BBS Automation Hallbergmoos
accounts.what_they_make: Assembly and injection-molding automation systems (local entity of a larger automation group).
accounts.why_fit: Assembly/test automation is drawing- and documentation-heavy; good pilot for automated drawing checks and manufacturing feedback loops (inference).
accounts.cad_plm_signals: Corporate signal: group states ~2,500 employees globally. (Local CAD/PLM stack unspecified.)

accounts.name: FIPA
accounts.what_they_make: Vacuum, gripper, and lifting technology; also customized system solutions around material flow.
accounts.why_fit: EOAT/gripper variants → repeatable drawings + DFM checks for machined/sheet-metal + purchased components (inference).

accounts.name: BAUER KOMPRESSOREN
accounts.employee_range: 201–500 (company size); group-level statements ~1,200–1,550 in job text
accounts.what_they_make: High- and medium-pressure compressors; German “Werk München” develops/manufactures compressors and systems.
accounts.why_fit: Safety-/compliance-driven mechanical products; strong fit for automated drawing checks and release discipline (inference).

accounts.name: Bucher Hydraulics Erding
accounts.what_they_make: Hydraulic components/systems; Erding site described as specializing in a defined product portfolio.
accounts.why_fit: Hydraulics = manufacturing-critical tolerances; DFM + drawing checks can reduce scrap/rework and shorten release cycles (inference).
accounts.cad_plm_signals: CAD signal from job posting: CAD ideally Creo and SolidWorks (plus CAQ/CAM references).

accounts.name: Güntner
accounts.employee_range: “~1,807 employees” visible on LinkedIn; “~5,000 worldwide” stated in a recruiting profile (treat as range).
accounts.what_they_make: Refrigeration and heat-exchanger solutions (industrial/commercial cooling).
accounts.why_fit: Heat-exchanger portfolios are configuration- and drawing-heavy; strong DFM leverage around sheet metal and assemblies (inference).

accounts.name: SENNEBOGEN
accounts.what_they_make: Configurable material handlers, cranes, telehandlers, and related equipment.
accounts.why_fit: Variant-rich heavy machines (weldments + hydraulics) → high document load and strong value from automated drawing validation and DFM checks (inference).
accounts.cad_plm_signals: Job postings publicly reference Siemens NX and Teamcenter for CAM/programming contexts (signal, not official stack confirmation).

accounts.name: DMG MORI
accounts.what_they_make: Milling-focused machine tool development/production site; >50 machine types noted.
accounts.why_fit: Precision machines with many BOMs/drawings; strong target for drawing automation, although org size may slow pilots (inference).

accounts.name: GROB-WERKE
accounts.what_they_make: Large manufacturing site; described as major employer with extensive production area.
accounts.why_fit: Large-scale engineering org; likely heavy drawing governance but potentially slower approvals (inference).

accounts.name: KraussMaffei
accounts.employee_range: 4,200 employees stated on company “in numbers” page
accounts.what_they_make: Plastics processing machinery/technologies; global footprint.
accounts.why_fit: Machine platforms + process equipment → drawing-heavy; org likely has formal standards where automated checking adds value (inference).

accounts.name: AL-KO Gardentech
accounts.what_they_make: Premium garden tools; R&D/manufacturing organization described as global player.
accounts.why_fit: Many SKUs and product variants → strong fit for drawing consistency checks and repeatable drawing pack generation (inference).

accounts.name: HMT Medizintechnik
accounts.what_they_make: Medical device manufacturer; “100% medtech made-to-measure” positioning.
accounts.why_fit: Regulated documentation + quality gates → strong ROI for automated drawing checks and revision traceability (inference).

accounts.name: EM Gerätebau
accounts.what_they_make: Sheet-metal fabrication and assemblies; CNC-based production.
accounts.why_fit: Classic drawing-heavy sheet metal + assemblies; ideal for automated drawing checks and DFM for bend rules/cutouts (inference).

accounts.name: Peschke & Kainz Gerätebau
accounts.what_they_make: Sheet-metal “Gerätebau”/assembly; emphasizes cost-optimized design advice depending on lot size/use case.
accounts.why_fit: Strong match for automated DFM review + drawing checking as a service to reduce quotation/iteration loops (inference).

accounts.name: GWK Präzisionstechnik
accounts.what_they_make: Lab devices + special machines; offers design, manufacturing, assembly, device documentation and certification.
accounts.why_fit: “Documentation-heavy” small org; high leverage for automated drawings + compliance-oriented checking (inference).
